input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command via command line
The specific file for which you wish to search.
The directory from which you wish to start the search. If no directory is entered then the value of / will be used for Linux and SunOS. For Windows: if no directory is entered
Recursive search (include all sub directories) is only valid for Windows O/S. Valid value: true

output.description: XML document consisting of one or more <line> elements that contain the command response. Each <line> element contains an index attribute indicating the order in which the information was returned by the command.
Did the operation succeed? Valid values: true

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="yes" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <fat-command> <command os-id="Linux"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">find</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory}') = 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> .</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[directory]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -name $[file]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -print</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="SunOS"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">find</xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory}') = 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> .</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[directory]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -name $[file]</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> -print</xsl:text> </xsl:if> </command> <command os-id="Windows Default"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">dir </xsl:text> <xsl:if test="string-length('${recursive}') != 0 and '${recursive}' = 'true'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> /s </xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${directory}') != 0"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no"> $[directory]\</xsl:text> </xsl:if> <xsl:if test="string-length('${file}') != 0">${file}</xsl:if> </command> </fat-command> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>
